render.tex: \title{Logarithm Basics} Definition and algebra of logarithmic terms

reason.tex:
%text By definition, \[ \qquad \log_b a = c \implies b^c = a \] In the above expression, both $a$ and $b$ are positive real numbers. $c$ can be negative Most of the time, however, we would only be writing $\log a = c$. It is understood that the logarithm is to the \underline\text{base $e$} \textbf{Algebra of logarithmic terms } % \begin{align}
\log (m\cdot n) &= \log m + \log n \\ \log \frac{m}{n} &= \log m - \log n \\ \log a^b &= b\cdot \log a \\ e^{\log m} &= m \\ \log e^{n} &= n\cdot\log e = n\,(\because \log e = 1) \end{align} %text %
